sentence.Network_en: She basked in the prosperity of the school like a purring tabby cat.
sentence.Network_cn: 她就象个悠然自得的,咕噜咕噜叫的雌猫一样,沉浸在这所学校的繁荣昌盛之中.

sentence.Network_en: Then I have four cats, Tabby and her three kittens.
sentence.Network_cn: 所以我有四只猫了, 它们是斑猫和她的三个孩子.

sentence.Network_en: The styles of the products include stripe, twill and tabby.
sentence.Network_cn: 有条纹 、 平纹、格子多种款式.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late 16th cent. (denoting a kind of silk taffeta, originally striped, later with a watered finish: see sense 2): from French tabis, based on Arabic al-‘Attābiyya, the name of the quarter of Baghdad where tabby was manufactured

entry.tran: 斑猫（毛皮上有深色条纹）
entry.def: A tabby or a tabby cat is a cat whose fur has dark stripes on a lighter background.

means.word_mean: 1. a cat with a gray or tawny coat mottled with black
1. having a gray or brown streak or a pattern or a patchy coloring; used especially of the patterned fur of cats
